t: Acts 8

And*p Saul was consenting unto his death. And at that time there was a great persecution against the church which was at Jerusalem; and they were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judaea and Samaria, except the apostles.
And*p devout men carried Stephen to his burial, and made great lamentation over him.
As*p for Saul, he made havock of the church, entering into every house, and haling men and women committed them to prison.
Therefore*p they that were scattered abroad went every where preaching the word.
Then*p Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and preached Christ unto them.
And*p the people with one accord gave heed unto those things which Philip spake, hearing and seeing the miracles which he did.
For*p unclean spirits, crying with loud voice, came out of many that were possessed with them: and many taken with palsies, and that were lame, were healed.
And*p there was great joy in that city.
But*p there was a certain man, called Simon, which beforetime in the same city used sorcery, and bewitched the people of Samaria, giving out that himself was some great one:
To*p whom they all gave heed, from the least to the greatest, saying, This man is the great power of God.
And*p to him they had regard, because that of long time he had bewitched them with sorceries.
But*p when they believed Philip preaching the things concerning the kingdom of God, and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.
Then*p Simon himself believed also: and when he was baptized, he continued with Philip, and wondered, beholding the miracles and signs which were done.
Now*p when the apostles which were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent unto them Peter and John:
Who,*p when they were come down, prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Ghost:
(For*p as yet he was fallen upon none of them: only they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.)
Then*p laid they their hands on them, and they received the Holy Ghost.
And*p when Simon saw that through laying on of the apostles' hands the Holy Ghost was given, he offered them money,
Saying,*p Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I lay hands, he may receive the Holy Ghost.
But*p Peter said unto him, Thy money perish with thee, because thou hast thought that the gift of God may be purchased with money.
Thou*p hast neither part nor lot in this matter: for thy heart is not right in the sight of God.
Repent*p therefore of this thy wickedness, and pray God, if perhaps the thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee.
For*p I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness, and in the bond of iniquity.
Then*p answered Simon, and said, Pray ye to the Lord for me, that none of these things which ye have spoken come upon me.
And*p they, when they had testified and preached the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and preached the gospel in many villages of the Samaritans.
And*p the angel of the Lord spake unto Philip, saying, Arise, and go toward the south unto the way that goeth down from Jerusalem unto Gaza, which is desert.

And*p he arose and went: and, behold, a man of Ethiopia, an eunuch of great authority under Candace queen of the Ethiopians, who had the charge of all her treasure, and had come to Jerusalem for to worship,
Was*p returning, and sitting in his chariot read Esaias the prophet.
Then*p the Spirit said unto Philip, Go near, and join thyself to this chariot.
And*p Philip ran thither to him, and heard him read the prophet Esaias, and said, Understandest thou what thou readest?
And*p he said, How can I, except some man should guide me? And he desired Philip that he would come up and sit with him.
The*p place of the scripture which he read was this, He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; and like a lamb dumb before his shearer, so opened he not his mouth:
In*p his humiliation his judgment was taken away: and who shall declare his generation? for his life is taken from the earth.
And*p the eunuch answered Philip, and said, I pray thee, of whom speaketh the prophet this? of himself, or of some other man?
Then*p Philip opened his mouth, and began at the same scripture, and preached unto him Jesus.
And*p as they went on their way, they came unto a certain water: and the eunuch said, See, here is water; what doth hinder me to be baptized?
And*p Philip said, If thou believest with all thine heart, thou mayest. And he answered and said, I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.
And*p he commanded the chariot to stand still: and they went down both into the water, both Philip and the eunuch; and he baptized him.
And*p when they were come up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip, that the eunuch saw him no more: and he went on his way rejoicing.
But*p Philip was found at Azotus: and passing through he preached in all the cities, till he came to Caesarea.
